Posts.Content: Hi there  I have had my first chemo session 7/02/17- I thought it went well but the 3rd day I started wheezing and coughing I have been to.hospital to get checked out my blood counts are all good and chest X-ray's are good but still have this wheezing and coughing and mucus which is brown - I have been given antibiotics over 7days which I take but there is no difference - is there anything else I could try I have tried warm water with lemon and fresh ginger but nothing seems to.work I don't want to keep.going to the gp as more at risk of infection my temperature is usually under 38 recently being 37.5 other than that don't feel unwell apart from giving myself a headache with th coughing -any advice will be appreciated xx
Posts.Title: Wheezing and coughing

Posts.Content: Hi everyone  Thanku so much everyone for getting back to me I did go out and get Manuka honey and also called oncology team as gave myself a headache with the coughing - and u guys were right it's an infection and also blood counts were down to 600 they have started to give me injections to boost that up Iv got to go in again today if blood count is not up.by tomorrow they will admit me in hospital as it was my first chemo session last week they can't say what side effects I would have until they start happening but hopefully I should be on the mend soon. Thanku so much everyone
Posts.Title: Wheezing and coughing

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn  Thanku so much for the reply I will try Manuka honey and also pick up the boots cough pastilles-  I have tried everything else - maybe an allergy but I'm not sure just tired of coughing and the wheezing although these antibiotics suppose to be good - amoxiclav - I will let u kno how I get along xx
Posts.Title: Wheezing and coughing

Posts.Content: Hi dreamtheif  Thanku so much I feel more positive about treatment it is exactly how u have explained it will be - they did say they will use a picc line and leave it in arm until over I don't usually have any issues wen giving blood which maybe a good thing - I will definitely get on with the free prescriptions and everything is so costly as I'm not bak at work till maybe treatment is over have been advised and signed off for a few months.  Thanku again as feel more at ease - this site and ppl on here are a godsend xx
Posts.Title: Her2 and hormone receptor positive

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne  Thanku so much for the reply the treatment plan is same as yours and dreamtheif - U guys have helped me more than you know today was scarey for me I have been going through all the paperwork I have been given and has finally sunk in and the tips and experiences on here are excellent to keep positive. Thanku
Posts.Title: Her2 and hormone receptor positive

Posts.Content: Thank-you so much everyone the experiences and knowledge I have learnt  from everyone here has made me stronger and more positive hopefully v will all get through this nitemare I have an appointment come through this morning is 6th Feb. I have been told will be havin the PICC line in arm it's great to know others whom have had same treatment as really does help prepare for it. Has anyone tried the cold cap? and also what is the effect on hair? I have been told to prepare myself with wig or hat I did go and get a wig which is nice and similar to my natural hair I have Also picked up hats and scarves as I don't think I will be able to cope with no hair - I will be definitely trying the cold cap but have been told may not help that much and waiting time after treatment is longer. Thank-you all again
Posts.Title: Her2 and hormone receptor positive

Posts.Content: Hi fidflercrab Thanku so much for replying as was going mad just thinking about it all xx
Posts.Title: Her2 and hormone receptor positive

Posts.Content: Hi there  Am Hoping for some advice on chemotherapy FEC-T and herceptin as pathology report says am HER2 and hormone receptor positive. Will be starting chemo in two weeks and am not prepared at all has taken a few days for me to.understand and sink in my head. Thanks in advance  So stressed xx
Posts.Title: Her2 and hormone receptor positive

Posts.Content: Hi bagpuss Definitely QE my PS surgeon is Mr Thomas and he is brilliant so far Iv only had breast reconstruction with expander waiting for chemo and radiotherapy which hopefully should be over with in September but as I did ask to see other ladies who have had complete reconstruction and what I did see was perfect they even give an uplift to make the other side look symmetrical 10/10. To QE. Hope all.does go well x
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon Birmingham / West Midlands area

Posts.Content: Hi pennymoon  That did make me smile and happy about your partner it's really brilliant he so supportive - me and my partner haven't really spoken about it much I live on own and he was always here but since diagnosis he has only stayed over one weekend the rest of the time he says his on long drive as hgv driver but v spoke on the fone all the time Even that's gone now past week we haven't spoken he says his phones been playing up or he was tired and fell asleep - to keep myself strong I keep telling myself if he can't be there for me through this there is no point of being with me at all I'd rather do this on own I do have close friends but I wouldn't want to talk about cancer all the time and partner issues I just have to see wer this ife takes me xx
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: Thank u so much for that I will definitely be asking the breast care nurse or.oncologist as really should be straight forward not just give me the good news at least this way I can prepare for wat the future holds xx
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: Thanku so much everyone I will definitely call breast care nurse first thing tomorrow xx
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: Hi everyone  I'm really concerned as drs and oncologist s really good but only give good news and not the bad I do understand but really should be clear as before mastectomy I was told early stage dcis then invasive grade 3- when met oncologist.he says her2 positive and hormone receptor positive aggressive cancer- I wen to have wig fit she had to fill in form and asked few questions she put down as secondary cancer even tho did explain drs and oncologist information but she said is secondary cancer I mustv got it wrong as too much info to take in when wen to visit oncologist- I have chemo in 2weeks and was very positive until seen wig lady although she was brill. Can anyone tell me if that is secondary cancer I do have an appointment on 30th where I will be asking oncologist as they really should be straight with good and bad info. Stressed and confused xx
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: You guys are the best Thank you so much- I'm not sure if fiance will be hanging around since I got diagnosed v seem to be drifting away he is always making excuses as he is a hgv driver it does hurt me but I have to focus on my health and treatment I cant be dealing with him too if his not going to stick by me through hard times I don't want him around when Iv recovered. Thank-you so much
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: Hi kacang Thank-you for putting my mind at ease I will definitely be talking to oncologist and breast care nurse all hospital staff have been excellent but because I didn't take it too well when was first diagnosed-  everyone here is in similar situations and hearing everyone's experiences and advise has got me through this weekend. Oncologist said is aggressive and lympnodes were clear but may have spread to other part of body as her2 and hormone receptor positive also was asked if wanted to freeze eggs if wanted to have children in future as I was suppose to get married this year- I will ask for mri scan and bone scan as theyv said they can't pinpoint exactly where it could have spread to they don't want to take any risks that's why want to do FEC-T +herceptin followed by radiotherapy then finally can have reconstruction - I will ask everything I can think of to put my mind at rest. Thanku so much everyone
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer

Posts.Content: After biopsy I was told is very early stages dcis but then pathology report said lympnodes clear and is grade 3 aggressive -my head was all over the place at the time I felt numb and shocked and broke down the on oncologist and breast care nurse were brilliant - I didn't ask any questions I had paperwork and booklets on treatment and Also primary cancer booklet - it's what the wig lady mentioned yesterday that totally floored me she said she had patients in the past withe same and theyv been told is secondary cancer - I don't think I will be going back to her have been scared out of my skin since but I will definitely give the hospital a call tomorrow. Xx
Posts.Title: Primary cancer and secondary cancer
